title: Bug 17825: ControlExampleText beeps when selecting SWT.MULTI
description: Bug 17825: ControlExampleText emits a beep when the user selects SWT.MULTI in the SWT Example ControlExample. This behavior is not expected.
OB: When selecting SWT.MULTI in the ControlExample, a beep sound is emitted. Additionally, clicking on other buttons in the ControlExample also produces the same beep sound.
EB: The ControlExampleText should not emit a beep sound when selecting SWT.MULTI. The behavior should be consistent with the selected button.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Launch the SWT Example ControlExample with build F1 (20020521) on Win2K.
2. In the ControlExample, navigate to the Text tab.
3. Select the Styles SWT.SINGLE button.
4. Re-select the Styles SWT.MULTI button.
5. Observe the beep sound emitted.
